originalText.text: We really enjoyed our experience here. It was warm out today in the low to mid 40's so the ice wasn't super great, a little like pond ice, but if you are looking for competition ready ice at a small outdoor winter rink you have unusual expectations. They ice was resurfaced right before we got on which was perfect as who doesn't love a fresh ice cut. To get to the edge of the ice check in was a breeze. We brought our own skates, but we're greeted warmly by the staff at the rental area all the same. Stepping onto the ice surface we immediately started to glide around and have a great time. The view of the water as the sunset was gorgeous. We look forward to heading back again to enjoy this rink.

originalText.text: Had a lot of fun, nice place! Twice cheaper than others city rinks. It was a sunny day and the ice was melting a little, there were some small puddles, but that didn't stop us from having fun. I advise you to come early in the morning or in the evening on a sunny day. but overall a very cool place, the kids loved it.

originalText.text: This has to be one of the most magical places in NYC simply because it so peaceful and such a great time with gorgeous views of the skyline and trees lit up for the holidays! My boyfriend and I went during Thanksgiving and it will be a memory we will never forget!

text.text: This has to be one of the most magical places in NYC simply because it so peaceful and such a great time with gorgeous views of the skyline and trees lit up for the holidays! My boyfriend and I went during Thanksgiving and it will be a memory we will never forget!

originalText.text: I was here at 3:10 to purchase a ticket but the women refused to take the card and told me to buy the ticket online. I was having problems with buying ticket online then I saw her taking other people’s cards right in front of me so I asked her again that why she wouldn’t take my card but theirs. Then she said that she doesn’t take cards but took other’s cs it was close to closing time. Which didn’t make sense cs it was an hour session starting at 3:15 and she started taking cards literally right after me. It just seemed like a lame excuse cs there were two card readers right in front of her that work perfectly. I was very disappointed with the service.

originalText.text:
By far my favorite rink in NYC. The blonde spanish girl, with the accent, in the front was really helpful and made booking a session extremely easy. Also, the guy inside the rink, who goes by Manny, was really helpful with how to properly wear and tie the skates. Would highly recommend this rink.
P.S.~ Nothing beats the view
